definition[0]: to be considered to be something
example[0]: Failing to complete the work constitutes a breach of the employment contract.
example[1]: The rise in crime constitutes a threat to society.
definition[1]: if several people or things constitute something, they are the parts that form it
example[2]: We must redefine what constitutes a family.
explanation[0]: In meanings 1 and 2, constitute is not used in the progressive You say
bad_example[0]: This is constituting a criminal offence
explanation[1]: However, the participle form constituting is often used
example[4]: Fish products are significant in Japanâ€™s imports, constituting 30% of the total
definition[2]: to officially form a group or organization
explanation[2]: Constitute is usually passive in this meaning
